cmd.ALLO: Allocate sufficient disk space to receive a file.
cmd.EPRT: Specifies an extended address and port to which the server should connect.
cmd.FEAT: Get the feature list implemented by the server.
cmd.HELP: Returns usage documentation on a command if specified, else a general help document is returned.
cmd.HOST: Identify desired virtual host on server, by name.
cmd.LIST: Returns information of a file or directory if specified, else information of the current working directory is returned.
cmd.LPRT: Specifies a long address and port to which the server should connect.
cmd.MDTM: Return the last-modified time of a specified file.
cmd.MFCT: Modify the creation time of a file.
cmd.MFF: Modify fact (the last modification time, creation time, UNIX group/owner/mode of a file).
cmd.MFMT: Modify the last modification time of a file.
cmd.MLSD: Lists the contents of a directory if a directory is named.
cmd.MLST: Provides data about exactly the object named on its command line, and no others.
cmd.MODE: Sets the transfer mode (Stream, Block, or Compressed).
cmd.NLST: Returns a list of file names in a specified directory.
cmd.NOOP: No operation (dummy packet; used mostly on keepalives).
cmd.OPTS: Select options for a feature (for example OPTS UTF8 ON).
cmd.PORT: Specifies an address and port to which the server should connect.
cmd.PWD: Print working directory. Returns the current directory of the host.
cmd.REST: Restart transfer from the specified point.
cmd.RETR: Retrieve a copy of the file
cmd.SITE: Sends site specific commands to remote server (like SITE IDLE 60 or SITE UMASK 002). Inspect SITE HELP output for complete list of supported commands.
cmd.SIZE: Return the size of a file.
cmd.SPSV: Use single port passive mode (only one TCP port number for both control connections and passive-mode data connections)
cmd.STOR: Accept the data and to store the data as a file at the server site
cmd.XCUP: Change to the parent of the current working directory

code.125: Data Connection already open; transfer starting.
code.150: File status okay; about to open data connection.
code.202: Command not implemented, superfluous at this site.
code.211: System status, or system help reply.
code.225: Data connection open; no transfer in progress.
code.230: User logged in, proceed. This status code appears after the client sends the correct password. It indicates that the user has successfully logged on.
code.350: Requested file action pending further information.
code.421:
Error 421 Service not available, closing control connection.
            Error 421 User limit reached
            Error 421 You are not authorized to make the connection
            Error 421 Max connections reached
            Error 421 Max connections exceeded
code.451: Requested action aborted: local error in processing.
code.452: Requested action not taken. Insufficient storage space in system.
code.500: Syntax error, command unrecognized, command line too long.
code.501: Syntax error in parameters or arguments.
code.504: Command not implemented for that parameter.
code.550: Requested action not taken. File unavailable, not found, not accessible
code.552: Requested file action aborted. Exceeded storage allocation.
code.553: Requested action not taken. File name not allowed.
code.10054: Connection reset by peer. The connection was forcibly closed by the remote host.
code.10061: Cannot connect to remote server. The connection is actively refused by the server.
code.10068: Too many users, server is full.
